説明文: One kan; thought to have been compiled by someone in Takamitsu's service.  The work, an account of Takamitsu's renunciation of the world, consists primarily of melancholy poems exchanged between the new monk and his wife and sister, including Anshi, during his tay at Mount Hiei (p. 92n).  [HW: Anonymous.  Written around 961-968. A tale about Takamitsu, the eighth son of Fujiwara no Morosuke, who left his family to take tonsure on Mt. Hiei, then lived in recluse in Tōnomine. Also known as Takamitsu Nikki.] [一巻、藤原高光、師輔、比叡山、高光日記]
